title: XDC Data Object definition
description: ECRIN Metadata Repository for clinical research objects, Data Object JSON definition, version 6 August 2021

id.description: Internal accession number of the data object within the MDR database

doi.description: The doi (without prefixes, beginning with '10...') of the object, if it has one

display_title.description: The title of the object - if a unique title is not part of the source title it may be a composite of the study title and the object type

version.description: Indication of version if there is one, in the format of the source data

object_class.description: The broad type of object, e.g. 'Dataset', or 'Text'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the object_classes enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the object_classes enumeration

object_type.description: A more detailed classification of the object type, e.g. 'Study Protocol', or 'IPD datasetâ€™

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the object_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the object_types enumeration

publication_year.description: A four digit number indicating the year the object was published, i.e. became available

lang_code.description: A two letter ISO 369-1 code indicating the language of the data object. Occasionaly - especially with journal articles - two or more such codes, separated by a comma

managing_organisation.description: The organisation managing the object, in particular that determines access to it

id.description: The id of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if that id exists

name.description: The default name of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if it exists, or the name of the organisation as supplied by the source data

ror_id.description: The id of the organisation, if knowm, within the ROR (Research Organisation Registry) system. This is a URL linking to the ROR resource.

access_type.description: The type of  access to the object, e.g. 'Public download (self-attestation required)', or 'Case by case download'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the object_access_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types from the object_access_types enumeration

access_details.description: Further details of the access (especially if non public)

description.description: A textual description of the access being offered, for example identifying the groups to which access is granted, the criteria on which a case-by-case decision would be based, any further restrictions on on-screen access, etc.

url.description: A url of a web page that provides details of the accesss available, possibly including the practical details required or a form to use to apply for access

url_last_checked.description: If a check has been carried out, the date the url last responded with a 200 (success) message, as a string (yyyy MMM dd)

eosc_category.description: An integer between 0 and 3 inclusive, representing the type of data object / access management required, using a recommended eosc categorisation

dataset_record_keys.description: For dataset objects only, provides an indication of the types of keys used in the dataset, in particular if they are claimed to be anonymous or pseudonymous

keys_type_id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the dataset_recordkey_types enumeration / lookup table

keys_type.description: One of the allowed types, from the dataset_recordkey_types enumeration

keys_details.description: Provides further details of the record key types, perhaps referring to dataset preparation, if available

dataset_deident_level.description: For dataset objects only, provides an indication of the level of deidentification of the dataset

deident_type_id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the dataset_identifier_types enumeration / lookup table

deident_type.description: One of the allowed types, from the dataset_de-identification_levels enumeration, e.g. 'De-identification applied'

deident_direct.description: If direct Identifiers were removed from the data set

deident_hipaa.description: If the US HIPAA de-identification rules have been applied

deident_dates.description: If dates have been rebased and / or replaced by integers

deident_nonarr.description: If narrative text fields have been removed

deident_details.description: Provides further details of the de-identification of the dataset, perhaps referring to other documents and / or a URL.

dataset_consent.description: For dataset objects only, provides an indication of the level of explicit consent for secondary use of the data

consent_type_id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the dataset_consent_types enumeration / lookup table

consent_type.description: One of the allowed types, from the dataset_consent_types enumeration, e.g. 'No explicit consent', or 'General research use'

consent_noncommercial.description: If further use restricted to non-commercial users

consent_geog_restrict.description: If any geographical restrictions apply to further use

consent_research_type.description: If further use is restricted to specific type(s) of research

consent_genetic_only.description: If further use is restricted to specific type(s) of research

consent_no_methods.description: If the data cannot be used for work that is purely for methodological / algorithmic development

consents_details.description: Provides further details of the consent for secondary use associated with the dataset, if available, and in particular any details associated with the specific restrictions listed above.

items.description: A composite object that indicates the nature of a specific instance of a data object, e.g. a file or a web page

id.description: Object instance record primary key, generated automatically in database
The id of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if that id exists

name.description: The default name of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if it exists, or the name of the organisation as supplied by the source data

access_details.description: Basic details of the access available to the instance

direct_access.description: Whether or not the access is public and freely available, or restricted in some way

url.description: The url where the object can be publicly accessed, if one exists

url_last_checked.description: If a check has been carried out, the date the url last responded with a 200 (success) message, as a string (yyyy MMM dd)

resource_details.description: Details of the instance, considered as a physical resource

type_id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the file_types enumeration / lookup table

type_name.description: One of the allowed types, from the file_types enumeration, e.g. 'PDF', or 'Excel Spreadsheet(s)'

size.description: A number (may be a real or an integer number) indicating the size of the resource

size_unit.description: One of the allowed types, from the size_units enumeration / look up table, e.g. 'Mb', or 'Pages', but note expressed only as a string

comments.description: Holds further details of the resource, in particular to support machine processing. These could include the schema used for XML files, and / or the character coding used for text files (e.g. UTF-8 versus UTF-16) or the presence and types of any byte order marks.

items.description: A composite object that indicates the type and value of the 'other title'

id.description: Other title record primary key, generated automatically in database

title_type.description: Type of the title, e.g. 'Translated Title'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the title_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the types listed in the title_types enumeration

title_text.description: The text of the title, verbatim

lang_code.description: A two letter ISO 369-1 code indicating the language of the title

comments.description: Any additional comments regarding the source or derivation of the title

items.description: A composite object that indicates the date and its type

id.description: Object date record primary key, generated automatically in database

date_type.description: The type of the date, e.g. 'Available', or 'Updated'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the date_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the date_types enumeration

date_is_range.description: If true both start and end dates should be considered, otherwise just the start date

date_as_string.description: String representation of the date, used for all dates including partial dates and date ranges

start_date.description: The date, or the start date of a range

start_year.description: A 4 digit integer indicating the year

end_date.description: The end date of a date range

end_year.description: A 4 digit integer indicating the year

comments.description: Additional comments or information about the date

items.description: A composite object that indicates the people and / or organisations that contributed to the data object, directly or indirectly

id.description: Object contributor record primary key, generated automatically in database

contribution_type.description: The type of contribution made, by an individual or organisation, e.g. 'Creator', or 'Trial Sponsor'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the contribution_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the contribution_types enumeration

is_individual.description: Indicates whether the contributor is an individual, e.g. study lead or paper author, or an organisation, e.g. pharma company or research network. If an organisation the person objhect will be null. If a person, the organisation object will be null.

organisation.description: The organisation providing the contribution - not required if the contributor is an individual.

id.description: The id of the organisation, within the ECRIN context database, if that id exists

name.description: The default name of the organisation, within the ECRIN context database, if it exists, or the name of the organisation as supplied by the source data

ror_id.description: The id of the organisation, if knowm, within the ROR (Research Organisation Registry) system. This is a URL linking to the ROR resource.

person.description: A composite object that should include as a minimum a full_name. Not required if there is an organisation entry

family_name.description: The person's family name, the 'key' name under which they are listed - usually the last name in Western cultures

given_name.description: The person's given name, or the first name by which they are nornally known. May be replaced by initials

full_name.description: The person's full name, in the order of given_name family_name

orcid.description: The person's ORCID identifier, if known

affiliation_string.description: The person's organisational affiliation as it appears in the source data

affiliation_org_id.description: The id of the organisation within the MDR, if it can be identified from the affiliation string.

affiliation_org_name.description: The name of the organisation to which the person is affiliated, as deduced from the affiliation string.

affiliation_org_ror_id.description: The id of the organisation to which the person is affiliated, if knowm, within the ROR (Research Organisation Registry) system. This is a URL linking to the ROR resource.

items.description: A composite object that indicates the topic name or keyword, and - where available - the MESH coding for that term

id.description: Study topic record primary key, generated automatically in database

topic_type.description: How the topic was categorised in the source data, e.g. 'Condition', or 'Organism'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the topic_source_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types listed in the topic_source_types enumeration

mesh_coded.description: Whether or not the topic has been MESH coded

mesh_code.description: The MESH code for the topic if one exists

mesh_value.description: The topic or keyword value or name, as a MESH code if coded, otherwise as provided in the source data

original_value.description: The original value of the term, whether coded or not

items.description: A composite object that indicates the value and type of the identifier, and optionally its date and organisation of origin

id.description: Data object identifier record primary key, generated automatically in database

identifier_value.description: The identifier value, in a standardised format (for each identifier type)

identifier_type.description: The type of identifier, e.g. â€˜Publisher IDâ€™

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the identifier_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the identifier_types enumeration

id.description: The id of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if that id exists

name.description: The default name of the organisation within the ECRIN context database, if it exists, or the name of the organisation as supplied by the source data

ror_id.description: The id of the organisation, if knowm, within the ROR (Research Organisation Registry) system. This is a URL linking to the ROR resource.

identifier_date.description: The date the identifier was allocated, if known, in a string 'yyyy  MMM dd' format, e.g. '2015 Dec 12'

items.description: A composite object that indicates the description and its type

id.description: Object description record primary key, generated automatically in database

description_type.description: The type of description (or description section), e.g. 'Table of Contents', or 'Abstract Section'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the description_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types in the description_types enumeration

description_label.description: A short label describing the nature of the description text, designed to be used as a possible sub-header in a display

description_text.description: The description text, as it appears in the source data

lang_code.description: A two letter ISO 369-1 code indicating the language of the description.

items.description: A composite object that indicates any usage and copyright rights associated with the data object

id.description: Object rights record primary key, generated automatically in database

rights_name.description: The name of the rights applied

rights_url.description: The url where details of the rights applied can be found, e.g. defintition of a creative commons variant

comments.description: Any additional comments, or a more detailed description of the rights regime

items.description: A composite object that indicates any related data object and the nature of the relationship

id.description: Object relationships record primary key, generated automatically in database

relationship_type.description: The nature of the relationship, e.g. e.g. 'Is metadata for', or 'Is supplement to'

id.description: An integer referencing the relevant record in the object_relationship_types enumeration / lookup table

name.description: One of the allowed types from the object_relationship_types enumeration

target_object_id.description: The id, i.e. internal accession number, of the related object

items.description: The id, i.e. internal accession number, of a linked study

provenance_string.description: A listing of the source or sources from which the data for the data object has been drawn, and the date-time(s) when the data was last downloaded
